sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal when the self-affine scaling parameter is set to 1/3? Express the answer as a decimal rounded to two decimal places.
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal can be calculated using the formula:

D = log(N) / log(1/s)

where D is the Hausdorff dimension, N is the number of self-similar pieces, and s is the self-affine scaling parameter.

For the Vicsek fractal, there are N = 5 self-similar pieces. When the self-affine scaling parameter is set to 1/3, we have:

D = log(5) / log(1/(1/3))
D = log(5) / log(3)

Using a calculator, we find that:

D â‰ˆ 1.465

So, the Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal when the self-affine scaling parameter is set to 1/3 is approximately 1.47 (rounded to two decimal places).
